website_summaries.verdict: The original, the most durable, and arguably the safest for a house with babies. Magna-Tiles are riveted together at the corners so they don't break when your son's creation topples onto the tile floor.
pros: Helps develop math, science, spatial, and tactile skills
Riveted together for extra strength and safety
Don't fall when building, like with traditional blocks
Don't break if they hit hard surfaces
cons: Magnets may not be as strong as other brands

customer_reviews.title: my daughter loved these for 5 years and still loves them.  Her favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loved these for 5 years. they really did great. i just noticed i did not write a review. here i am 5 years later. she loved them and they lasted. she walked on them, they fell repeatedly for years on our cement floors, they did not break. magnets popped out of one when she threw it at the floor but that is to be expected. these are some resilient magnets. if my review was helpful please click the yes button below so I know it was helpful, thank you
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Poor magnetism
customer_reviews.text: I avoided the cheaper off brands because I was worried about poor magnetism. Sadly to say the Magna-Tiles have very weak magnets and I can’t even build a cube that well without it collapsing so easily, Very disappointed I spent $120 on these things thinking they would be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schermerhorn

customer_reviews.title: poor quality, choking hazard
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was that the magnets are a lot weaker than whatever brand my son plays with at preschool. They're frustrating to use, even for me, and the kids will spend time carefully building something for it to accidentally collapse. We havent even had them for a whole month yet and they're starting to break. My 2 year old could eat these little magnets that have come out so that is really dangerous. I thought these were supposed to be heirloom quality, to be passed down to my kids kids etc but they havent even lasted my own kids a single month
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: Weak Magnets... Kids get frustrated very fast with how weak the structures are.
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are so weak that the structures fall over so easy. If you look up online, the older version of these had stronger magnets. Definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: scubasteve

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: My box was missing three pieces. By the time I noticed, my kids had already used them and was not comfortable returning them to amazon. Amazon did say I could exchange or return them despite being used. However, I tried to contact the manufacturer to no avail. Now you might think three pieces is no big deal but this is an expensive set and I expect it to be full. I would recommend d the toy itself but make sure you count the contents before using them.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough - will return it.
customer_reviews.text: I spent some time deciding to give this product a chance. It is expensive but I was ready to spend the money so my 4.5 years old can enjoy it. Unfortunately it is not the quality I expected for the price. It does not hold and the tiles fall off. Also the plastic is cheap quality. I am going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Yash

customer_reviews.title: you won't regret buying these!
customer_reviews.text: get these. go ahead and splurge. one of the rare toys that make the "if i could only buy ten toys for my child their entire life" list. get them for toddlers and young school-age kids, adults and older kids will love them, too. i have no experience with the cheaper version, but i can attest to the fact that this brand is extremely durable. we've had them for four years and have had many children play with them, some very roughly, including throwing them, and they have held up.
customer_reviews.author: Eponine

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have another set and these are terrible. The plastic is completely awful and of poor quality compared to the other ones I have. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Drew G

customer_reviews.title: Crazy expensive, but well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw these things I was shocked at how crazy expensive they were, but some of my other "mom friends" assured me they were well worth their weight in gold. They were right! Magna-tiles rock! My kid plays with these things a ton and I can really see the gears working in her mind when she is engaged in one of her many building projects. So yes, psychotically expensive, but go for it! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: My Son loves!
customer_reviews.text: I was told my son was getting in a lot of arguments at preschool over the Magnatiles. So I bought my son his own set for home for his 3rd birthday. My parents got him the car bases that went with them. He LOOOOOVES them. We got right before the covid shutdown so provided lots of indoor, Michigan winter with covid lockdown, entertainment! Definitely recommend the car bases to go with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite birthday gift! 🥳
customer_reviews.text: These Magna Tiles were my son’s favorite birthday gift for his 6th birthday ❤️ Half of the set my 9 year old daughter stole to build😂 Survived the 1 year old knocking them down😆 For years my kids have played with these at the library. I knew they were durable & would hold up. Definitely worth the full price! I plan to buy one additional set per year so each of my 3 kids has one. The building ideas are endless! My 6 year old includes his cars & building characters in his building ❤️
customer_reviews.author: borderchick

customer_reviews.title: Hours and hours of creative play!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of tiles (100) that I have purchased for my grandson (age 4) and granddaughter (age 3). Both children get hours and hours of creative play from these amazing, magnetic tiles. He builds garages and race tracks for all his cards and trucks,, she builds castles and buildings for all hr Peppa Pig figurines! It amazes me to see what they create with these tiles giving them hours and hours of playtime! They NEVER get tire of these magnetic tiles. Even more older grandchildren, ages 8, 10 and 12, enjoy creative play with their cousins! High recommend for all boys and girls, and all age groups.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Bonita

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson initially encountered these at church, playing with them in the children's area. It's his favorite part of church. We were out shopping at Target and found some other brand tiles. They just didn't seem to be quite a solid. We were doing some price comparison with the smart phone while we were in the store. We found the Magna-Tiles on Amazon for a comparable price and knew the quality of this brand so we made the purchase while we were in Target. When my grandson came over and open these at our house on Christmas, he was SO excited. It was his favorite gift this Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Roy Houston

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them busy
customer_reviews.text: Love that these keep my 2.5 and almost 4 year olds busy for an hour. I just think they are soo expensive and I even got them on sale. A lot of the other reviewers are right about getting a second set. 100 pieces combined seems small once they build something with it and we even had the magnatile house set already to combine with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin J

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to buy these for my 2 year old for Christmas because they were so expensive, but her daycare teachers said she loves playing with them at school, so I went ahead and got them. I'm SO glad I did! She loves playing with them and uses them almost every day. At just over 2 years old, she can play quietly and independently with these for quite a while, and they're fun for adults too - whenever you get pulled into playing with your kids! I know she will use these for years! They are great for fine motor skills and problem solving skills!
customer_reviews.author: gababit

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I honestly expected a little more from Magnatiles, especially for the price. I read wonderful reviews stating they had the strongest magnets, but I was not impressed after receiving the product. Don't get me wrong - these are a GREAT toy - my husband and I even like building with them! However, we played with a friends Playmags set recently and they were the same magnet strength... maybe stronger. I am honestly bummed I spent so much on these because the other (cheaper) brand were the same or better. I have already ordered the Playmags train for my kids. Also - the box I received was taped together with scotch tape... seemed kind of strange to me!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, this product was shipped with only half of the promised tiles
customer_reviews.text: Half of the tiles were missing when this product arrived .
customer_reviews.author: john j.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, durable, inspiring
customer_reviews.text: I figure for manufacturer liability this toy is marked only for age three and up. However this wonderful construction set of clear colorful tiles is also good for age one and up. I’m a daycare and own 4 sets (400) of these tiles and they have been heavily used. I have never had to throw one away because of being chipped or having a loose magnet or for any other reason. One year olds stack them and older kids create incredible buildings with these tiles. So versatile and enduring as a toy. I also have the Magformers.
customer_reviews.author: Gail E.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable building toys
customer_reviews.text: So any kid that's ever visited my home, including my own children, absolutely adore these toys. My middle child likes to use them to build unique parking garages for his small cars. My youngest prefers to get use them as props for imaginary play, so she likes to build castles and such. My oldest just likes to see how tall he can build up. I highly recommend buying multiple sets over time as well, as my children's sharing experience with these with only one box was less than admirable. Positive side note is that these are way more durable than you would imagine as well.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: My toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. My toddler loves to build high towers with these Magna tiles and loves to tear them down as quickly as he built it. We have two sets so he builds towers taller than himself. I myself, enjoy playing with him building different shaped things with this. Would highly recommend this item for encouraging creativity and because it's a good quality product!
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Magnetiles are wonderful for both younger children (3-5) and older children (6-10)
customer_reviews.text: Magnetiles are wonderful for both younger children (3-5) and older children (6-10). Younger children find them less frustrating than traditional blocks because magnetic fields aid in construction stability. Older children find their creativity peaked by the unexpected ways the blocks can hinge and hold together as opposed to building with traditional blocks.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Grandson plays with these for hours!
customer_reviews.text: Initially, the adults in the house were frustrated with these, in comparison to their experience with Magformers. However, after a little more exposure, adults and 3-1/2 year old grandson were addicted to building creations. We have all enjoyed them so much, my daughter bought an additional set to complement this one, so we don't find ourselves limited when one of us is creating along side the little guy.
customer_reviews.author: momX3

customer_reviews.title: Awful!
customer_reviews.text: These are awful! The magnets are a joke. Not only did these bring about zero joy Christmas morning, they make my children downright angry because their creations collapse over and over again. Can’t believe I spent so much time trying to find a “good deal” on these. No such thing.
customer_reviews.author: Casey1226

customer_reviews.title: Great tiles, but we'll buy Playmags again next time
customer_reviews.text: Great fun tiles. We bought both these and the 100 Playmags set. I don't see any noticeable difference between them except for color or shapes. I was worried about a cheaper "off brand" being worse in quality than the origional tiles. I watched many videos and read a lot of reviews, so we bought them both. They are the same, and playmags has slightly stronger magnets. If we want more, we will be buying the Playmags.
customer_reviews.author: El Loco

customer_reviews.title: Best and longest lasting toy so far
customer_reviews.text: One of the best building toys today. Practically indestructible (I saw one in the street one day that had been run over by cars, brought it home and it still worked). No boundaries on imaginative play. Fantastic way to learn about how different geometric shapes can be used together. Initial set really needs more pieces, so bought this as the starter set for another child. Unlike Legos, this can be used endlessly -- as young as 2, as old as 10 or 12 (but they might want a second set to build higher / bigger). A large base plate can be purchased separately, that's the only useful option other than more pieces.
customer_reviews.author: tspia

customer_reviews.title: Bright colors and a favorite choice for play
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter who is two at the time of this writing. We have lots of kids that visit and lots of adults too. Everyone seems to enjoy playing with these. The colors are bright and there's just something about the way the magnets work that is so fun to explore. They can certainly be expensive for some but I think this is the kind of toy that will last into the next generation. I'm always looking to add classic games and toys and this is one of the best. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Laya Saul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy - all ages and for many years
customer_reviews.text: We gave them to our four year old grandson. He loves them and is very creative. However, he has to share with his two-year old sister and his 35-year old dad. You can Google for ideas for building amazing things. There are many YouTube videos that will give you inspiration. Yup, they are expensive...but build well and will last a long time. My friends recommended this toy and reported their kids/grandkids play with these for years.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice A

customer_reviews.title: Never ending fun!
customer_reviews.text: My three-year old LOVES these. He plays with them all day at daycare, then comes home and plays with them all night. I nannied for a young girl who played with them from 2-10. They are worth the money! We just had to buy another 100 piece set. So good for imagination and motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Magnatiles are expensive, there's no doubting that However, you really do get what you pay for with magnet-style building toys. Our young preschoolers have a different, cheaper set of magnet building toys and the difference in quality is apparent. Magnatiles seem to build easily and feel like quality toys. Not to mention they've crashed on our hard-wood floor and chucked off the deck- still fine.
customer_reviews.author: H Family

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Play
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of the best toy purchases ever. I was a little hesitant given the price, but got these for my 4 year old for Christmas and it's one of his go to toys still! He's even figured out to put 2 together and hold them up to the light to see how it makes different colors. Great for creative play. And for a rough playing 4 year old, not a one has broken yet. My wife was a little worried they wouldn't last long, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my great niece and nephew, 4 and 7 years old. They BOTH loved them! The girl fashions cakes from the tiles and both make all sorts of buildings. These are the best magnetic tiles around since the magnets are strong and therefore easy to build with. The structures, or cakes, hold together well, even when very tall! The colorful see-through format is a plus. They are expensive and I wondered about that, but seeing how well designed they are, I think it was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: B K Branum

customer_reviews.title: all our grandkids love these
customer_reviews.text: These toys and others in the series are a bit expensive, but totally worth it. Our grandkids head right for the box and dump them out and play with them for hours. Nice quality. take quite a beating. They encourage their imagination, as well as give them practice with numbers and fractions, 3D thinking. really love them.
customer_reviews.author: karen mueller

customer_reviews.title: Total rip off!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond disappointed in the quality of these tiles. They have such a big name, and an outrageous cost, you’d think they’d be amazing. WRONG! My three year old couldn’t build anything, as the tiles just fell over during construction. This was meant to be a Christmas gift, but was given early because I was so excited for them. Glad I did, because this would have made for a horrible gift.
customer_reviews.author: Margery

customer_reviews.title: Mother exclaimed, "We love Magna-Tiles"
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about the tiles but for their weight, however that meant more for the children receiving them whose mother exclaimed, "We love magna-tiles". And they did play with them intermittently our entire weekend visit.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up STEM toy
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing STEM toys. I love how creative kids can be and the huge plus is that they are SOOO easy to clean up since they’re magnetic. I dislike that you can’t wash them with soap and water and they are SOOO expensive. Standard rate is $1/piece. I saved some money during the holiday season when the went on sale so that helped.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy that promotes creative play
customer_reviews.text: As with all magnatile products we have- great quality, their magnets are strong enough to construct towers and elaborate shapes. Our daughter builds space shuttles and planes with magnatiles that she mans with playmobil figures as pilots and passengers. We like the even surfaces that allow for matchbox cars to use them as ramps when a parking garage is constructed... We often play as a whole family with magnatiles, constructing different buildings for a city landscape... Excellent toy that truly promotes creative play
customer_reviews.author: rb

customer_reviews.title: This is the best toy you can buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toy you can buy. It develop the mind of the children. They start at 2 years old with 2 dimension construction (they work doing drawings with the tiles in 2D). At about 3 years they start building in 3 dimension (boxes piramids and others) and increasing the level of complexity year by year. I bought 4 boxes (400 piece) and its the best investment I ever done in toys.
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: A great toy, but prepare to buy additional sets if multiple kids play at once
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these Magna Tiles and I love seeing the creations they make from them. There are only two downsides: 1) they are quite expensive and 2) you will likely need more than you think, especially if you have more than one child. 100 pieces get used up quickly; I ended up buying another set of 100 plus and additional ~10 pieces for my two children, and we often find that it's hard for both kids to make exactly what they want.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: I love the tiles which are an absolute must for any ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the tiles which are an absolute must for any kid. However, I ended up purchasing a second set from a different brand, and it had same 100 pieces plus a little car, plus a booklet with ideas, plus a bag to hold all of the pieces together and it was better priced! Magna tiles did not offer any of the little details and was more expensive. So the actual toy is great and is a definite yes, but you may find a better value for your money with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Anz26

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy!
customer_reviews.text: Second set of magna tiles I've bought for my boys. They have so much fun with them and needed more of them to build bigger things. Both the 4 year old and 2 year old can use them although the little one need a lot of help. Great toys that grow imagination, creativity, motor skills and really is just plain fun. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Magnatiles are the best
customer_reviews.text: Magnatiles are always worth the money. I bought these for my preschool classroom, and yesterday my own children (10 and 12) tested them out for me. They built for over an hour and had a great time. I knew what I was ordering because I have played with these before. I plan to buy a couple more sets over the years to build up a nice collection. I know these will be in frequent rotation in the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren, ages 7 and 4, were so excited that I bought there these magnatiles. They both played with them and their imaginations were boundless. When my son suggested they keep them at my home in CT instead of their small apartment in NYC they cried. I bought them a backpack to transport them back and forth and am now adding pieces on. They are very expensive but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Zwerdling

customer_reviews.title: Endless creativity with zero frustration
customer_reviews.text: Amazing toy. These are expensive, but I think they are worth the cost if one can afford them. They are made in such a way that the pieces go together with just a touch. They automatically align themselves against one another, so there is no need to fiddle with getting them in place. The structures that can be created are endless. They are also very sturdy and have held up to being walked on many times. My two grandsons, ages 3.5 and 5.5 have played with these more than any other toy. They proved to be so great that we purchased a second set. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: joanieD

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Bad Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure my grandson will love this. (His preschool has them and he really enjoys them.) The packaging was terrible, however. Shipping label was attached directly to the Magna-Tiles box. No protective packaging whatsoever. Box was dented and one end flap was open. Can't remove labels without damaging the box further. Sort of tacky for a Christmas present. I doubt he'll notice the box, but it was upsetting to me.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: A hit with my 4- and 6-yr old
customer_reviews.text: My 4- and 6-yr old niece and nephew stopped unwrapping Christmas gifts after they opened this because they were enamored! Have had hours of fun with it already and instantly figured out how to build really amazing structures. One note, the box is large so if you’re traveling with it you’ll need a big suitcase (larger than carry on case),or ship it to them, or by two of the smaller packs.
customer_reviews.author: Lucie

customer_reviews.title: So versatile and encourages creativity!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! We have 2 sets and haven’t had any problems. They are plastic, so they can break, but we make sure the kids understand you can’t throw them, step on them, etc. And we play on a “play mat” so when they inevitably crash, they crash on a softer surface than tile, for example.
customer_reviews.author: emmybeu

customer_reviews.title: Twice the cost. Exact sme magnetic strength as stick n stack
customer_reviews.text: We love these types of toys. But I paid twice as much as our stick n stack magnets hoping that these would have significantly stronger magnets. These have the exact same size and strength of magnets. I was severely disappointed considering I could have purchased 200 stick n stack magnets for the same price. Clearly someone is banking on huge margins over material costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good imagination toys
customer_reviews.text: Kiddos sit and build and build and build. Breaking the buildings is almost as fun for them as building. Easy to clean up. Really fun to watch and even more fun to join and play with the kids. The complement packs (large squares, wheels) really helpful
customer_reviews.author: ALAN E BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Staple in the Pre-K Room
customer_reviews.text: As a Pre-K teacher, this is a staple in the classroom. Students gravitate towards this toy as it is an open-ended building experience. I've had these for a couple years and they have withheld the massive wear and tear of little hands building and knocking them over. They do dull/ scratch after a lot of use but, to me, this is expected. They still do their job just the same.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Z

customer_reviews.title: Beat magnetic tile brand
customer_reviews.text: I have age 2 to 10 year old grandchildren. The two year old can build towers higher than he is. Don’t buy the other brands. They are not nearly the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: My kids loved this from when they were 1
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved this from when they were 1.5 years old until now (the oldest is in second grade). They way they play with these tiles evolves as my kids get older. My kids, who are into Pokemon, are now building gyms for Pokemon gym battles and mountains with different levels inside. They put their Pokemon figures within their creations (before they used their animal figures) They use their imagination and have so much fun with this. We have had these for around 6 years. Albeit, we did get more sets upon request by the kiddos. None of the pieces have broken and none of the magnets have fallen off.
customer_reviews.author: jeni W

customer_reviews.title: They were not clear -- were just the regular colorful ones
customer_reviews.text: My niece already had the colorful ones and I wanted to giver her the clear ones with Frozen stickers so she could build an Elsa castle, but the box that actually came had colored tiles. Did not have time to return before Christmas. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Hermine

customer_reviews.title: Great quality/ nice beginner set for collection
customer_reviews.text: These tiles are built with high grade plastic. I have several sets and have never had a broken tile. My kids have put them through smashing towers, stepping on tiles and even throwing them. While they are pricey, they are built to last. Also makes for a great collection. There are many different sets, shapes, colors (glow in the dark even) and figurines you can purchase to build with.
customer_reviews.author: Dana P

customer_reviews.title: Still daily use over 6 mos since purchase
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set, highly recommended for kids preschool and beyond. My kids are 5 and 7 and they are still creating and enjoying these daily since we bought them 6 months ago. Having a large set like this (>100 pieces) adds more and more opportunities to create. These also make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAandE

customer_reviews.title: Gift for 3 & 5 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my nephews to share for Christmas. I have heard that they like them. I was a little shocked at the price, having never heard of these before, but they came highly recommended as a gift for kids and I normally budget $50 per kid so this worked.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Kept the Picasso Tiles instead
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and the Picasso tiles, returned the Magna Tiles because they were more than double the price for no apparent reason but brand name. The Picasso tiles are just as durable, the magnets are just as strong. Why pay so much more for the same value propositions?
customer_reviews.author: Hotbones

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this
customer_reviews.text: Pricey. But, it's a holiday gift. Kids spend hours and all ages love it. The little ones figure it out faster than the adults! Easy size pieces, easy clean up, fun clean up because of the magnets. So many lessons to learn while playing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sloan

customer_reviews.title: These are better for him than blocks that fall down
customer_reviews.text: My two year-old will play with these for 15-minute spans, which is a longtime for this age. These are better for him than blocks that fall down. And there are endless possibilities for building with these. They do appear pricey, but they are well worth it. Think of all the inexpensive toys that you buy that are rarely or never played with. These will get great usage for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: Magna tiles are super expensive but this 100 pc set is the best deal for your money, especially if you get it when Amazon has a coupon for it. Kids love these tiles and this is the best brand out there. Endless hours of imaginative play. These can be stacked really high if done right. I took off 1 star because for the price this should come with a storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: All of my kids enjoy these! My Three-year-old up to my 17-year-old Play with them. This is now the gift that I give at every birthday. I have provided my kids with hours of entertainment, which is giving me hours of silence and time to clean. I love that there are little pieces that will get lost around my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Goodyke

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toy that gets them away from screen time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my grandsons starter 41 piece set last year. On cold Brooklyn days felt a good indoor activity. When there we build amazing things "but need more blocks!" So added this 100 piece set. This is a thinner set than magnaform tiles but I like the opaque colors and assortment of triangles and less expensive. This is a toy that they don't outgrow for a long time. Stimulates imagination, creativity, cause and affect (how tall before it falls!) artistic skills as they examine they Wal it looks afterwards. Great travel toy as could pack small and something to do in hotel rooms if trying to get kids off screen time.
customer_reviews.author: The Traveling Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Best present we bought the kids- they are still playing with them!
customer_reviews.text: Best gift we bought our kids for Christmas and the only one they still play with- we have since bought boxes more of these- they are a favorite in this house! Hours and hours of play! I didn’t anticipate them loving these so much! Very hard to keep our boys attention and these amazed me at how they played and played with them!
customer_reviews.author: David Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Magnatiles help prevent child boredom!
customer_reviews.text: We are Magnatiles fans for life. Wish they offered special designs - glitter, mirrors, glow in the dark at prices comparable to these set. These are not cheap, but worth it. Our kids (and the parents too) love them. Creativity at its finest!!

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: There is no limit to the imagination with these blocks. I have bottom several times to continue adding to the collection for my grandson and granddaughter who spend hours building everything from castles to Towers two houses to Tracks for their cars. It is one of the best gifts I’ve ever gotten them.
